text: Alvin and the Chipmunks is an American animated music group. It was created by Ross Bagdasarian, Sr. in 1958. The group is made up of three animated chipmunks who sing and talk. They are Alvin, Simon and Theodore. The trio is managed by a fictional man named Dave Seville, who adopted the chipmunks. In reality, "David Seville" was Bagdasarian's stage name, and the chipmunks themselves are named after the executives of their original record label. The characters became a success, and were recreated in animated cartoons and eventually movies. The voices of the group were all done by Bagdasarian. He recorded his voice and then sped up the playback to create high-pitched voices. It was so unusual and well-done that it earned the record two Grammy Awards for musical engineering. Bagdasarian, performing as the Chipmunks, released a long series of albums and singles. Bagdasarian died in 1972. The characters were revived in the 1980s and 1990s, with the voices being performed by Ross Bagdasarian, Jr. and his wife Janice Karman. A computer- animated movie based on the characters was released in 2007, called Alvin and the Chipmunks. It had three sequels: one in 2009, one in 2011 and one in 2015. The actors Justin Long, Matthew Gray Gubler and Jesse McCartney performed the talking voices of the Chipmunks. Bagdasarian, Jr. and Karman performed the singing voices for Alvin, Theodore and the Chipettes, but Steve Vining does Simon's singing voice. The project has earned five Grammy Awards, an American Music Award, a Golden Reel Award, and three Kids' Choice Awards, and has been nominated for three Emmy awards. ==Television series== *The Alvin Show (1961-1962) *Alvin and the Chipmunks (1983-1990) *ALVINNN!!! and the Chipmunks (2015-) ==Main characters== * David "Dave" Seville is the adoptive father of the Chipmunks. He is a human. He was played by Ross Bagdasarian, Sr. and later Ross Bagdasarian, Jr. In the movies, he is played by Jason Lee. * Ian Hawke is the Chipmunks and Chipettes former nemesis and Dave's former arch-rival, he is played by David Cross. * Alvin is the lead singer of the Chipmunks. He is the middle of his brothers. He was voiced by Ross Bagdasarian, Sr. and later by Ross Bagdasarian, Jr. In the movies, he is voiced by Justin Long. His singing voice is done by Ross Bagdasarian Jr. * Simon is the oldest brother. He is a very intelligent chipmunk. He was voiced by Ross Bagdasarian, Sr. and later by Ross Bagdasarian, Jr. Matthew Gray Gubler voiced Simon in the movie series. His singing voice is done by Steve Vining. * Theodore is the youngest of his brothers. He was voiced by Ross Bagdasarian, Sr. and later by Janice Karman. In the movies, he is voiced by Jesse McCartney. His singing voice is done by Janice Karman * The Chipettes is a girl group of chipmunks. It is made up of Brittany (voiced by Christina Applegate in the movies), Jeanette (voiced by Anna Faris) and Eleanor (voiced by Amy Poehler in the second and third films and Kaley Cuoco in a fourth film). * Agent James Suggs is the Chipmunks nemesis of U.S. Air Marshal, he is played by Tony Hale. ==Other characters== * Claire Wilson, played by Cameron Richardson * Gail, played by Jane Lynch * Toby Seville, played by Zachary Levi * Zoe, played by Jenny Slate * Simone, voiced by Alan Tudyk * Samantha, played by Kimberly Williams-Paisley * Ashley Grey, played by Bella Thorne * Miles, played by Josh Green ==Other websites== * Chipmunks.com, Bagdasarian Productions' official site Category:American boy bands Category:Anthromophic characters Category:1950s American music groups Category:Children's musical groups Category:American Grammy Award winners Category:Musical groups from California Category:1958 establishments in California Category:Musical groups established in 1958 Category:Musical groups disestablished in the 1970s Category:1972 disestablishments in the United States Category:Musical groups established in 1979 Category:1979 establishments in California Category:1970s disestablishments in California Category:American Music Awards Category:Fictional characters introduced in the 1950s
